channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My job is offering me a payout. Should I take a $61,000 lump sum — or $355 a month for life?
item.description: “My S&P 500 investments have roughly doubled every seven years.”

item.title: Tesla stock gets punished as Musk says he’ll start third political party. ‘This is not the news we want to see.’
item.description: Tesla stock is weaker in premarket trade as investors react to Elon Musk’s announcement that he will form a new U.S. political party.

item.title: $14.5 million Cape Cod home once owned by Taylor Swift finds a buyer
item.description: The opulent dwelling is steps away from the iconic Kennedy family compound, and was owned by Swift in 2012, when she enjoyed a short romance with Robe...

item.title: ‘We are blessed’: My husband is inheriting a $1 million home. Should he put it in my name too?
item.description: “We do not live in a community-property state. We have one son who is now a young adult.”

item.title: ‘She’s in a shaky marriage that could soon end’: Will my daughter’s husband get my IRA when I die?
item.description: “I’m 84 and widowed. My daughter is the beneficiary of my IRA and the successor trustee for my revocable living trust.”

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts are pounding the table on these 3 stocks
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service highlights three stocks, including Dell Technologies and Amazon, favored by Wall Street's top pros.

item.title: Investors expect bitcoin to break out to new records in the second half from a consolidation phase
item.description: Bitcoin is ready for takeoff as companies accelerate their bitcoin buying sprees and Congress gets closer to passing cryptocurrency legislation.

item.title: Gen Z and millennials embrace health and wellness. These stocks could benefit
item.description: Bank of America credit card data shows Gen Z and millennials are spending more on health and wellness.

item.title: The tech sector still has legs in the second half, and Deepwater's Gene Munster likes these names
item.description: "We're in the camp that AI is going to measurably surprise to the upside this year," Munster told CNBC Pro in an interview.
